DOC.brief_summary: Genetic variation , i.e . polymorphism , may associate gender dysphoria , e.g . transsexualism . This study aim identify variation .
DOC.brief_title: A Common Polymorphism SRD5A2 Gene Not Associated With Male-to-Female Female-to-Male Transsexualism
DOC.detailed_description: Context : Early developmental exposure brain sex steroid may play role etiology transsexualism . Objective : To assess association transsexualism allele genotype frequency steroid 5-alpha reductase ( SRD5A2 ) Val89Leu polymorphism . Design Patients : We perform case-control study 100 male-to-female ( MtF ) transsexual , 47 female-to-male ( FtM ) transsexual , 755 male control , 915 female control . DNA extract buccal swab genotype determine polymerase chain reaction . Results : SRD5A2 Val89Leu allele frequency ( SRD5A2 V : 137/200 [ 69 % ] SRD5A2 L : 63/200 [ 31 % ] vs. SRD5A2 V : 1065/1510 [ 71 % ] SRD5A2 L : 445/1510 [ 29 % ] , respectively ; p=0.6 ; Odds Ratio [ OR ] 1.10 ; 95 % Confidence Interval [ CI ] 0.76-1.58 ) genotype distribution ( SRD5A2 V/V+V/L : 92/100 [ 92 % ] L/L 8/100 [ 8 % ] vs. SRD5A2 V/V+V/L : 683/755 [ 91 % ] L/L 72/755 [ 9 % ] , respectively , p=0.7 ; OR 0.82 ; 95 % CI 0.24-2.84 ) significantly different MtF transsexual male control . SRD5A2 Val89Leu allele frequency ( SRD5A2 V : 70/94 [ 74 % ] SRD5A2 L : 24/94 [ 26 % ] vs. SRD5A2 V : 1253/1830 [ 69 % ] SRD5A2 L : 573/1830 [ 31 % ] , respectively ; p=0.3 ; OR 0.75 ; 95 % CI 0.45-1.26 ) genotype distribution ( SRD5A2 V/V+V/L : 44/47 [ 93 % ] L/L 3/47 [ 7 % ] vs. SRD5A2 V/V+V/L : 823/915 [ 90 % ] L/L 92/915 [ 10 % ] , respectively , p=0.6 ; OR 0.61 ; 95 % CI 0.11-3.32 ) also significantly different FtM transsexual female control . Of note , gender-specific genotype distribution among control . Conclusions : The SRD5A2 Val89Leu polymorphism associate transsexualism candidate gene condition .
DOC.criteria: transsexual individual define DSM IV criterion unwillingness participate
